SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

org.aoplib4j.modularity
Annotation Type PackageBoundary

@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=PACKAGE)
public @interface PackageBoundary

Annotation to mark the classes on which the package boundary calls should be applied. This annotation should be put on the classes to mark from which packages the calls of the annotated class are allowed or forbidden.

Author:
Adrian Citu

Required Element Summary
 java.lang.String[] packagesList
          The list of packages on which the boundary will be applied.
 ListType packagesListType
          Enumeration to express the type of packages contained into the packagesList().
 
Optional Element Summary
 java.lang.Class<? extends BoundaryViolationCallback> callbackClass
          The class the will be instantiated by the framework when a boundary violation is detected.
 

Element Detail

packagesList

public abstract java.lang.String[] packagesList
The list of packages on which the boundary will be applied.

packagesListType

public abstract ListType packagesListType
Enumeration to express the type of packages contained into the packagesList(). If ListType.BLACKLIST, the packagesList() contains the list of forbidden packages, if ListType.WHITELIST the packagesList() contains the list of allowed packages.

callbackClass

public abstract java.lang.Class<? extends BoundaryViolationCallback> callbackClass
The class the will be instantiated by the framework when a boundary violation is detected. The default callback class is LogViolationCallback.

See Also:
LogViolationCallback
Default:
org.aoplib4j.modularity.LogViolationCallback.class
